meanings.definition: A person who asks questions or seeks information.
meanings.sent1: The querists in the library were looking for books on different topics.
meanings.sent2: The group of querists gathered around the tour guide to learn more about the historical site.
meanings.sent3: The querists at the science fair were on a mission to uncover the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent4: Her curious nature turned her into a querist, always searching for new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The querists at the conference were like detectives, eager to solve the puzzle of the speaker's research.

meanings.sent1: The querists raised their hands in class to ask the teacher about the assignment.
meanings.sent2: The querists at the event formed a line to get their queries answered by the expert panel.
meanings.sent3: The querists at the town hall meeting had so many questions, they almost ran out of time.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the querists, knowledge was the most valuable treasure.
meanings.sent5: The querists in the online forum shared their inquiries with fellow seekers of information.
